content.body:
For the ShadowRealms topic, I've inserted the comment that I wanted to make in the notes, which was:

I recommend applying the criterion, â€œShadowRealms should contain the intersection of whatâ€™s in all conceivable environmentsâ€, which implies that they are missing everything to do with I/O [excluding import()], timers, DOM, etc. https://github.com/tc39/proposal-shadowrealm/issues/398#issuecomment-1939418911
Bit-packing breaks down badly once concurrent threads are introduced. C++ found out about this the hard way.
I agree with the set of things that are spec'd as Exposed=* that Igalia has put together--they seem to be following this principle already.
A key requirement is that writes to different variables must be independent.

content.body: Does anyone want to volunteer to audit the PDF when it's ready? If a handful of volunteers took a few clauses each (just scrolling through and making sure there's no unfortunate page breaks mostly) then I'd feel a lot more confident with the final product
it's like 900 pages, my eyes keep glazing over
